stu_tags: SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  AMAZING LECTURES  CLEAR GRADING CRITERIA
comments: Prof Daimsis is by far the best professor. He believes in his students\' competence and refuses to spoon-feed case ratios. His exams are extremely fair! Yes, he has high expectations during lectures for students to come prepared and understand the cases, but his exams are solely based on information discussed, and aren\'t filled with trick-questions

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Hilarious (3)  Participation matters (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
stu_tags: HILARIOUS  GRADED BY FEW THINGS  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.
comments: A prof unafraid to poke fun at the ever-so-slightly non-PC material. What a breath of fresh air. Course is engaging and he encourages participation. Muster up the courage to ask/answer questions in class, and I guarantee you\'ll walk away with solid understanding of contracts. Really knows his stuff, and will actually help if you ask in office hrs.

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Hilarious (3)  Participation matters (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Good prof. Laid back and funny. Mandatory 1L class (content/PPTs set by the school?), so the material wasn\'t the most exciting, but he does a great job sifting through the important/not-so-important info. Teases students but isn\'t mean... ADR will be fun if you keep this in mind & participate.

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Hilarious (3)  Participation matters (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: He\'s been described as a "moot god" at school before, hence "respected" in my tags. He\'s funny, he gets through the material, and does indeed give off that "sleezy lawyer" vibe. That said, he cares about teaching students how to be lawyers rather than simply teaching student the law. If you can get him for ADR, I recommend him.

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Hilarious (3)  Participation matters (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Great guy but not a great prof, hes lectures are a tad boring and detailed but then again there are very few classes he shows up for. The class itself is interactive with lots of opportunities for engaging questions and debate. Lively class overall and generally nice guy who also happens to be the moot coach for the law school.

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Hilarious (3)  Participation matters (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
stu_tags: PARTICIPATION MATTERS  TOUGH GRADER  GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK
comments: Big fish in a little pond syndrome. Brags a lot to elicit the admiration of students. Arrogant demeanor. Phones it in during most lectures (probably bc he\'s bored with material he knows well, and it\'s all about him, not about your learning). Superficial charm - has that sleazy lawyer vibe. But you will learn some useful techniques.

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Hilarious (3)  Participation matters (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: This class is challenging but rewarding. This class will prepare you for the "real world" and is a must-take if you are prepared to put the work into it. I was also better prepared for my contracts exam because he compares and contrasts international contracts with the common law. He will make you think outside of the box.

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Hilarious (3)  Participation matters (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Listen 0Ls, if you take his thematic class be ready for an intense wrap up to the course in terms of workload (for a 1L thematic course anyway), but Daimsis is hands-down the best prof I had this year. If you\'re interested in the subject, you won\'t regret it.

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Hilarious (3)  Participation matters (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: You probably wont get an A, but you have to be really dumb and not pay attention at all to get lower than a B. Just listen to what he says in class and do his practice exams and youll do fine.

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Hilarious (3)  Participation matters (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Daimsis is an excellent professor. Those complaining about him are just poor law students who do not know how to write an exam. He expects clarity in writing and well thought out answers. If you\'re a crappy writer and do not understand legal precedents, his class is not for you. One of the best uOttawa has. Heads up the Moots for a REASON.

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Hilarious (3)  Participation matters (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: If you\xe2\x80\x99re an extremely gifted student this professor is for you however, if you are not stay as far away as you possibly can from this showboat. Oh he\xe2\x80\x99ll entertain you BUT WITH his final I guarantee that any laughter will come to a screeching halt when you see what he serves up to you. Use to A\'s & B\'s, welcome to your 1st C or worse!

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Hilarious (3)  Participation matters (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Great prof, funny, knows is his stuff about international trade law and UNCITRAL. One of the most engaging classes I\'ve had at law school. U of o is lucky to have this prof... let\'s hope the school doesn\'t screw up and lose him to the private sector.

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Hilarious (3)  Participation matters (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Not as impressed as some other posters. I wasn\'t taken by his superficial charm and found that he was incredibly condescending; he quickly skimmed over cases including some very tricky concepts. Contrary to what he says, he does try to trick you in his NP contracts exam which is 2 hours but should be 3. Doesn\'t always respond to emails....

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Hilarious (3)  Participation matters (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Prof with benefits ;)

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Hilarious (3)  Participation matters (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Hard maker no doubt but fair. If you show interest and demonstrate that you are trying he will help you to achieve the success you\'re working towards. Was awarded capital educator\'s award for 2011 and by no accident. I entered contracts law dreading it and walked out loving contracts. Must take class. He will teach you the law correctly.

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Hilarious (3)  Participation matters (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Amazing prof! Very enthusiastic and passionate. Makes you work hard and think for yourself. Can be arrogant and sarcastic, but is still overall entertaining and makes you want to succeed!

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Hilarious (3)  Participation matters (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Should not be teaching first year contracts. Displayed palpable disregard for the students in his class. Does not hold regular office hours. Canceled classes. Skipped over readings. Did not review course material prior to exams. Marking was arbitrary. Avoid.

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Hilarious (3)  Participation matters (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Good first year contracts prof, will force you to think mroe like a lawyer and work things out on your own. He is friendly, but some find him intimidating. However, he slacks off in 2nd term to focus on his moot teams. He is a fair marker (although consistency is questionable) but he will try to trip you up on the exam, and then deny it.

tag_professor: Respected (3)  Hilarious (3)  Participation matters (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Amazing lectures (1)  Tough Grader (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Great guy to have as a first year prof. Teaches the law and gives you the tools you need to think for yourself - but he doesn\'t make it easy. You have to work for it, which in the long run is a good thing. Also, if you say stupid things in class he will call you out on it, so think before you talk.
